Blog.post: urlLink It was a family affair! urlLink

urlLink Michael graduates from East Chapel Hill High School - Class of 2004. He graduated at the Dean Dome on the UNC campus and this fall will be attending Lynchburg College in Lynchburg, Va. Michael is with cousins Ashley and Emily Gibbings and younger brother Jacob urlLink
Well Michael graduates from East Chapel Hill High School on Saturday (6/12/04) so I thought it might be time to keep track of our lives. Things they are a changin.....

urlLink Last week 7/19 - 7/23 Corey (on the left) and Jacob attended a Lacrosse Camp. This picture was taken with my new LG Vx7000 picture phone and emailed to my mindspring account. A bit fuzzy but I am working on it. urlLink
urlLink Tim navigates with a PDA with GPS capabilities. Capt. John keeps a close eye on this "Cabin Boy"! After this sailing adventure Tim graduated to a "Cabin Man" urlLink
urlLink The "Self Reliance" a 37' Dickerson that Nancy and I get to go sailing on. We sailed with the Harrisons out of Irvington, Va. this summer. urlLink
urlLink Our sailing friends, Capt. John and Judy Harrison urlLink

Jacob is back from a week at boy scout camp. He was down at camp Durant, down by Carthage, NC. This week he is off to Lacrosse Camp during the weekday mornings. He received all the gear he needed to play competitively for his birthday, so we expect he will try to play for Smith Middle school this coming year. Kelly is down in Fayetteville with the cousins and Michael is home working with me. Nancy is hard at work at Duke this week also.
Well plans change by the hours. Looks like I get to stay home during the 4th Holiday. Which is fine because I have alot of work to do! I wonder what the plans will be next hour?

About the 16th of June we had Nancy's aunt and uncle (Hal and Shirley Metz), now from sunset beach, NC, come visit. Not a week later my aunt and uncle from Churchland, Va (Sam and Blanche Bisese) came for a night. The following Sunday (6/26) my aunt from Hawaii (Arlene Schwab, my mother's sister)came down for a night. She apparently came back to Virginia for a high school reunion, then on to Roanoke, Va and then down here to Chapel Hill, NC. She had a friend from Hawaii who had relocated in the area down in Pittsboro, NC, about a 15 minute drive south of Chapel Hill. So now we prepare for the 4th of July! Nancy and the kids will be at Harker's Island for the week of the 4th for a summer vacation. OH YEA........as of July 1, 2004 the HOKIES are in the ACC! Miracles do happen, Hell has frozen over. I am only sorry my Dad didn't get to see this! Leo Barber class of 1961, Tim & Nancy Barber class of 1979. We are sorry to announce that Nancy does have a Wahoo in the family!
